user.title: EV Charge Planner
user.description: Configure charging for one electric vehicle using confirmed day-ahead electricity rates and a longer-term forecast. Confirmed rates always override forecast prices.

data.name: Vehicle name
data.current_soc_entity: Current state of vehicle charge sensor (%)

data_description.name: A friendly name for this vehicle. Used to label sensors and devices.
data_description.confirmed_current_entity: Authoritative electricity prices for today, typically provided by your energy supplier integration.
data_description.confirmed_next_entity: Authoritative electricity prices for tomorrow, often published in the afternoon.
data_description.forecast_rates_entity: Predicted electricity prices used only when confirmed rates are not available.
data_description.current_soc_entity: A sensor reporting the vehicle’s current state of charge as a percentage (0–100).
data_description.daily_usage_entity: Expected battery usage per day as a percentage. Used to estimate tomorrow morning’s SoC.
data_description.battery_kwh_entity: Total usable battery capacity of the vehicle in kilowatt-hours.
data_description.charger_power_kw: Maximum charging power in kilowatts (kW). Used to calculate charging duration.
data_description.min_morning_soc: Minimum acceptable state of charge required by tomorrow morning.
data_description.soc_buffer: Additional safety margin added on top of the minimum morning SoC.
data_description.full_tomorrow_target_entity: Target state of charge to reach by tomorrow morning when Full tomorrow mode is enabled.
data_description.deadline_enabled_entity: When enabled, the planner attempts to reach a target state of charge by a specific future date and time.
data_description.full_by_entity: The date and time by which the vehicle should reach the target state of charge.
data_description.deadline_target_entity: Target state of charge to reach by the specified deadline.
